content: garter bonnet gauge sizes yarn recommendation stitchonary 18 sts = 10 cm 0-6 6-12 12-24 months stitch & story lil merino co - cast on 20 garter ridge row = 10 cm bobble - bind off materials needles and notions k - knit measurements 100g of worsted weight yarn us 6 4mm needle p - purl height 15 5 18 20 cm blunt tapestry needle p2tog - purl two stitches together st/sts - stitch/stitches cast on using a us 6 needle co 60 70 75 sts k until piece measures 11 5 12 12 5 cm finish on wrong side row and begin bobble on right side back panel bobble 20 23 25 sts knitwise k till end of row 40 47 50 sts bobble 20 23 25 sts purlwise k remaining 20 24 25 sts row 1 knit row 2 p2 sts k until 2 sts remain p2 sts repeat row 1 and 2 until back panel measures 6 6 5 7 cm you will have created a 2 st k edge this variation in stitching helps when its time to seam the piece and gives the bonnet a finished look row 1 knit row 2 p2 k2tog k till 4 sts remain k2tog p2 repeat row 1 and 2 until 6 8 11 sts remain on needle bobble all stitches finish using a tapestry needle begin seaming the sides of the bonnet to the back panel i-chord ties pick up 3 stitches at each side of bonnet and create ties using i-cord method knit i-cord until it measures 25 cm bobble weave in ends enjoy adella
